alert.note: Alert for Davidson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Davidson County through 400 PM EDT... At 325 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lexington. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Thomasville, Gordontown and High Rock Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
